cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTVS GOYESNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. January 1940.SECRET. Copy No. 41W.M. (40)12th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 12 (40).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Sunday, January 14, 1940, at 12-30 p.m.Present :Admiral of the Fleet the Right Hon. Lord Chatfield, Minister forCo-ordination of Defence (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Oliver Stanley, M.P.,Secretary of State for War(Designate).The Right Hon. Winston S.Churchill, M.P., First Lord of theAdmiralty.The Right Hon. Sir Kingsley Wood,M.P., Secretary of State for Air.The following were also present:The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan, , Admiral of thePermanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.General Sir W. Edmund Ironside,Chief of the Imperial General Staff-Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Air Marshal R. E. C. Peirse, DeputvChief of the Air Staff.Secretariat.Sir Edward Bridges.Captain A. D. Nxcholl, R.N.Lieutenant-Colonel E. I. C. Jacob, R.E.Western Front.possible german attackon Holland andBelgium.(previous reference:W.M. (40) 11thConclusions,Minute 5.)The War Cabinet had under consideration Telegrams Nos. and 9 from Brussels, and certain information communicated to themby the First Lord of the Admiralty on possible future events in belgium.A full record of the discussion, and of the conclusions reached,is contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet conclusions.Richmond Terrace, S.W.1.January 14, 1940.[20645]
